Header: Prime Minister begins his Maldivian tour – Four agreements are signed
Content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe states that Sri Lanka and the Maldives have an important role to play in establishing regional peace as small islands in the Indian Ocean. Premier Wickremesinghe made this statement during a media briefing in Maldives. The Prime Minister is visiting the Maldives following an invitation extended to him by the Maldivian Prime Minister Ibrahim Solih. The Prime Minister and his entourage were warmly welcomed at the Velana International Airport in the Mali capital. Foreign Minister Abdulan Shahid and a group joined in the occasion. Thereafter the visitors including the Prime Minister were conducted to the Mali capital Republic Square in a special trawler procession. On arrival they were welcomed by the Maldivian President Ibrahim Mohamed Solih and Maldivian Ministers. A seven gun salute was accorded in honour of Premier Wickremasinghe. The visitors were then conducted to the President’s House in the Maldives in a dancing procession depicting the culture of the Maldives. Meanwhile Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe is due to chair the Indian Ocean Conference which will be held tomorrow and the day after in the Maldives Island. Four agreements aimed at consolidating cooperation between the two countries, granting of visa facilities, social protection, vocational training and youth development as well as higher education were also signed. Ministers Rauf Hakeem, Vajira Abeywardena and Daya Gamage as well as State Minister Anoma Gamage and Prime Minister’s Secretary Saman Ekanayake are accompanying the Prime Minister in this visit.
